text.p: Former world champion Jackie Stewart signed Danish driver Jan Magnussen for his new Formula One motor racing team on Monday.
Magnussen, 23, has agreed to a four-year contract with the Ford-powered Stewart Grand Prix team which will make its debut in the 1997 season opener in Australia next March.
"Jan is the best Formula Three driver I have ever seen, including Ayrton Senna. He displayed an outstanding talent in the formative classes of the sport," Stewart said.
Magnussen, who made his debut for McLaren Mercedes at last year's Pacific Grand Prix in which he finished 10th, has already had a successful association with the Stewart name.
He made his debut for Paul Stewart Racing, the team run by Jackie's son, in 1993 winning the Formula Three title with them the following year.

"I am absolutely thrilled to have a seat in Formula One for next season. My dream come true," Magnussen said. "It is a real pleasure to be going back to the Stewart family whose experience and professionalism I trust and respect."
Paul Stewart said: "When Jan Magnussen drove for us in Formula Three he displayed both raw talent and an enormous potential to become a successful Grand Prix driver."
Magnussen began his driving career in traditional fashion in karting, winning the world title in 1990. He has been the McLaren test driver for the past two seasons.
He competed in the last four IndyCar races of this season for Penske.
Stewart-Ford will announce their second driver at a later date.
